description.plain:
Born on February 11, 1998, Khalid (Full name: Khalid Donnel Robinson) became a prominent R&B artist from El Paso, Texas, after Kylie Jenner featured his 2016 hit “Location” on her Snapchat. Khalid’s music seemingly boosted into the mainstream, he signed to RCA Records only months after graduating high school, and he released his debut album, American Teen on March 3, 2017. The album included the two successful singles, the aforementioned “Location,” “Young Dumb & Broke,” and another single “Saved.”

On September 14, 2018, Khalid released his next project, an EP titled Suncity, in relation to El Paso’s nickname. Khalid would follow this up with his second studio album, Free Spirit, which was released on April 5, 2019.

description.plain: “Young Dumb & Broke” finds Khalid convincing a love interest that their youth allows them to be “young” and “dumb.” Though Khalid feels like there’s no need for romantic commitment, he’s still has love to give. He shows that love can be given in many ways and that all deserve a chance for love.

description.plain:
Khalid described “Location” in an interview with Pigeons and Planes:

‘Location’ is a story of young love. The kind of love that you would travel all over the country to find. It’s just a story of searching for something that we all want in life no matter who we are and that’s a real genuine lover, but it doesn’t come easy.

The track reached a wider audience after Kylie Jenner featured it in her Snapchat story on May 27th, 2016—Khalid appreciated the boost.

description.plain:
“Better” serves as the follow up to Khalid’s previous single “OTW” which featured verses from both 6LACK and Ty Dolla $ign. Although his previous single was all about being there for a significant other, “Better” highlights the necessity for being there for each other.

On first listen this song sounds like a love song, but dive deeper and it’s about hooking up on the low, or being friends with benefits with someone and how nothing feels better than the sexual relationship that they share.

The cover art features a handwritten note:

with love, to the 915 – Khalid!

Khalid shouts out his hometown El Paso, Texas, where the area code is 915. “Better” was released the day before Khalid’s El Paso “915 Hometown Show” on September 15, 2018.

description.plain:
“Talk” is the lead single from Khalid’s sophomore album. The song marks his first collaboration with electronic production duo Disclosure.

In the song, Khalid laments about a relationship moving too fast and the need for communication between both members of the relationship.

The song was teased by Khalid a day before its release and premiered on Zane Lowe’s Beats 1 Radio show:

https://twitter.com/Beats1/status/1093517780161200131?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

description.plain:
In a verified annotation below, Khalid disclosed that “Saved” was about a relationship he had in El Paso. His moving to New York put stress on the relationship:

We soon decided, after I moved, that the relationship wasn’t as necessary as it was. She had to find herself. I had to find myself. But at the same time, we always let each other know, “I’ll keep your number saved in case you need me. In case you need someone to talk to. If you want a conversation. If you fall for me again.” It was a sense of comfort, just by having her number. I still have her number to this day.

description.plain: Khalid sings a somber ballad about a possible past love interest. He describes this woman he has loved. He knows that she never treated him the way he wanted to be treated and is afraid to move on without this person he will love unconditionally. Although he wants her, time passes and he realizes that he will be better without her and says he will not be there for her when she returns because he realizes now she is not the one for him.

description.plain:
“OTW,” an acronym for “On The Way,” is a track all about being there for a significant other. Khalid, Ty Dolla $ign and 6lack all express their ability to be on call for that special someone.

The song was first teased by Khalid on March 30, 2018 in a tweet with the caption “on the way”, then announced by all three artists on the 16th of April that the song would be released on 4/20.

description.plain:
In this song Khalid is singing about a girl who is going through tough time, has family issues and her parents don’t care. They are absent and Khalid cares about her in ways her parents don’t care/didn’t take the time to learn about her.
He could also be talking about a girl who is a stripper or an escort, with the second verse supporting such a theory by sounding like a cliché stripper story. Khalid understands her and cares despite her situation and job.

This song could also be about the negligence of her parents. They let her do whatever, and never really took time to bond with her and understand her.

description.plain:
On the title track to Suncity, Khalid and Empress Of explore a concept of escaping to El Paso, Texas, Khalid’s hometown, where his heart lies and he can leave everything behind.

description.plain:
Khalid simultaneously compares a girl’s love to “drugs” and “therapy,” painting it as a relaxing escape in more ways than one. Whilst it seems the rest of life may be getting him down, she’s his “therapy,” or the means by which he helps himself cope.

Like on “Young, Dumb and Broke,” Khalid admits that he’s “not one for relationships.” Despite this, he stills “needs [her] therapy.”

description.plain:
“Another Sad Love Song” is Khalid trying to “get over how it all went wrong.”

Using the classic images of ‘turning tables’ and ‘burning bridges,’ Khalid cryptically outlines the disintegration of a relationship. It seems that he might be at fault – he references his emotional unavailability as something that played a role in their break up.

description.plain:
“Reason” is Khalid’s first single that has not been released under an album. His other 2016 singles such as, “Let’s Go,” “Hopeless,” and “Coaster,” were all released on his debut album American Teen.

The track explores reasons for loving a girl. Khalid explains that this girl deserves all of his love because she gives him multiple reasons to love her.

description.plain:
“Cold Blooded” finds Khalid heartbroken. He’s given his heart to a girl who’s treated it poorly, but he’s unwilling to take it back – whilst he wants an explanation, he also wants her just as much as he did before.

He’s “cold blooded” – without his heart, he needs her contact to sustain his life. Without touching each other, he wouldn’t be able to sustain his body temperature, much like cold blooded animals (such as lizards).

description.plain:
“My Bad” is the third official single from Khalid’s second studio album Free Spirit, released on March 7, 2019.

The song deals with a similar theme to the one from the previous single, “Talk,” as there are still problems of communication between Khalid and his lover. However, this time, arguments have worsened and he seems tired of facing these difficulties.

description.plain:
“Eleven” is expected to be the second single from Khalid’s upcoming third studio album. He first teased the track on Twitter and Instagram on January 7, 2020, two days before its release.

The track is all about driving with a significant other, and is over a slow, acoustic-centered instrumental. Khalid croons to his significant other about their relationship, as well as asking about her feelings for him.

description.plain:
“Self” is the fourth official single from Khalid’s second studio album. It follows “My Bad” which was released earlier in the month.

The introspective song finds Khalid in a self-reflecting mode as he addresses his anxieties, fears, insecurities and working to make himself a better person.

He announced the songs release through a tweet, revealing the title, it’s number on the album’s tracklist and release date along with the cover photo.
https://twitter.com/thegreatkhalid/status/1110293680986820608?s=20

description.plain:
“Free Spirit” is the title track of Khalid’s Sophomore album, which was released on April 5, 2019.

On “Free Spirit, Khalid is ready to let go of all of his worries and live his life in its purest form, and he invites someone around him to do the same.

description.plain:
“Hundred” is the ninth track of Free Spirit, and the
message behind the song is for listeners to keep themselves composed and focused throughout the numerous concerns we face in life. And the word hundred, which serves as the title of the track, is used in different contexts throughout the song.

Primarily to describe the multitude of aforementioned obligations Khalid, in particular, has to deal with. And as such, he is not privy to give in to distractions.

Amongst these potential setbacks are friends and other people who do not have Khalid’s best interests in mind. But ultimately he does not let such interactions knock him off balance. Instead, he stays focused on the hundred things (he has to) do today while simultaneously acknowledging that circumstances will not always be ideal.

description.plain:
“Don’t Pretend” is the sixth official release from Khalid’s second studio album Free Spirit, released on April 5th, 2019.

The track was released just two days prior to the album’s release, with fans around the world having the opportunity to hear the full album earlier by watching the ‘Free Spirit’ short film in select cinemas on the same day.

description.plain: ‘Intro’ is Khalid’s induction to the 2019 album ‘Free Spirit’. Khalid describes a relationship that he is clinging to, despite the fact that it is clearly not working out, because he doesn’t know who he is outside of it and is terrified of facing the world outside of the safe, secure context of a relationship.

description.plain:
Three months after the successful release of his debut album American Teen, Khalid links up with Lil Yachty and Rae Sremmurd for an unexpected remix.

With each artist being 25 or younger, they all could share their experiences with living life as a young person in this society. Swae Lee and Lil Yachty specifically express how their come ups pushed them past the “Young, Dumb & Broke” lifestyle.

description.plain:
On “Alive,” Khalid reflects on this transition period in his life as he grows from not only a teenager to a young adult, but from an aspiring artist to a superstar. Keeping his thoughts and feelings to himself throughout these changes has taken its toll on him.

Looking ahead to what is still to come, he looks to improve his state of mind.

description.plain:
Paradise is the eighth track on Khalid’s Sophomore album Free Spirit.

The song explains how Khalid and his lover’s “Free Spirit” attitude is effecting their relationship. They pray to repent from their wickedness only to fall back into their old ways. But their love will make it through the hard times.

description.plain: Heaven is almost Khalid’s last song on the album. It ties perfectly into the previous song “Alive” in which he talks about dying in order to be alive. In this song, Khalid talks about losing someone close to him, perhaps a significant other or best friend. Although it’s never explicitly stated whether or not this individual is physically taken from the world or is just no longer friends with Khalid. Regardless, Khalid is crushed, and he shows it in this song. He speaks in a helpless kind of tone, saying that this is it. He says that he’s ready for heaven to take him away, that there’s nothing left for him. This is probably his most dramatic difference of Free Spirit Khalid from American Teen Khalid

description.plain:
21, a detrimental age and of course the title of one of Khalid’s new song. This song does not handle the greatness and joyfulness of turning 21, but the eventual sorrows. The song provides a contrast from Khalid’s 8TEEN released just 2 years earlier.

A well appreciated contrast to the rest of the album that just increases the width and depth of the album.

body.plain: Salem’s Interlude is the fourth track on Suncity. This dialogue explores Khalid’s fears, where he is going with his life, and his happiness.

songs.lyrics:
[Dialogue]
I think I'm fearful of things like traveling
I'm fearful of failure
I'm fearful of being embarrassed
Things like that, I think hinder me from doing the best that I can sometimes
But I think that if I learn to be less fearful
I would get further
I feel like I'm not always in the correct direction
Even though I know I'm on the right path
I'm like "I'm on the right path"
But am I walking the right way, or should I be turning around?
Like little things like that that I go back and forth about in my head
And I think it's always nice to have reassurance
I think it's really nice to see how far being a genuine person can get you
For me at least, like I think that's the reason that I am where I am
I think that I am a big mix of all the people around me
And I'm just happy
I can't complain about anything
Oh yeah
That I'm trying to get so motherfucking high, nigga
I don't wanna feel nothing (Wait, what?)

description.plain:
This is the remix of “Eleven” which is expected to be the second single from Khalid’s upcoming third studio album. He first teased the track on Twitter and Instagram on January 7, 2020, two days before its release.
Khalid decided to shoot the music video for the remix with Summer Walker.
The track is all about driving with a significant other, and is over a slow, acoustic-centered instrumental. Khalid croons to his significant other about their relationship, as well as asking about her feelings for him.
